item.name: Check-out a particular document and download it

request.description:
**IMPORTANT:** Version management has to be activated for the file cabinet you are using.

The response contains the generated file name in the header "*Content-Disposition*"

E.g.: Content-Disposition → attachment; filename=18+41537414-0df0-4d08-adb5-fa40564b80f9+EmploymentContractWithBarcodeOnBothP.pdf

**IMPORTANT:** You have to use this file name if stored the document to the file system!

request.description:
The response contains the thumbnail that represents the first page of the document.   
The document is specified in request using it's doc id.  
Additionally you can specify section and page number (see request parameters).
Download document that is specified using it's doc id in the request.

item.name: Search for documents in multiple FileCabinets

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<DialogExpression xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" Count="100" Operation="And" CompleteConditionInInvariantCulture="false" xmlns="http://dev.docuware.com/schema/public/services/platform">
    <SortOrder>
        <OrderBy Field="DWSTOREDATETIME" Direction="Desc" />
    </SortOrder>
    <Condition DBName="DWDOCID">
        <Value>1</Value>
    </Condition>
    <AdditionalCabinets>00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</AdditionalCabinets>
    <AdditionalCabinets>00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000</AdditionalCabinets>
</DialogExpression>

query.description: The dialog guid with zeros filled represents the default dialog.

request.description:
The search dialog must be in every file cabiinet zou want to search for documents.
In the body the additional cabinets are responsible for the file cabinets where you want to search.
